identificationModule.briefTitle: EXercise Cardiac Magnetic Resonance Assessment of Left Atrial Mechanics Following Ablation
identificationModule.officialTitle: EXCLAMATORY: EXercise Cardiac Magnetic Resonance Assessment of Left Atrial Mechanics Following Ablation TO Reduce Atrial Fibrillation Burden and Correlation With Exercise CapacitY Longitudinal Study

collaborators.name: National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI)

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Longitudinal, observational cohort study to evaluate changes in left atrial (LA) reservoir function during exercise and overall exertional capacity in patients following catheter ablation for paroxysmal atrial fibrillation (AF).
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: EXCLAMATORY is a longitudinal observational cohort clinical research study to evaluate the effects of catheter ablation for paroxysmal atrial fibrillation on left atrial and left ventricular performance during exercise, as well as effects on overall exercise capacity

armGroups.label: Patients under going catheter ablation
armGroups.description: Patients undergoing catheter ablation for paroxysmal AF, reduction or elimination of arrhythmia burden
interventionNames: Behavioral: Self- Report Evaluation-Duke Activity Status Index
Behavioral: Self- Report Evaluation Atrial Fibrillation Effect on Quality of Life Questionnaire
Diagnostic Test: Ambulatory cardiac rhythm assessment

interventions.name: Self- Report Evaluation-Duke Activity Status Index
interventions.description: Complete the Self- Report Evaluation-Duke Activity Status Index

interventions.name: Self- Report Evaluation Atrial Fibrillation Effect on Quality of Life Questionnaire
interventions.description: Complete the Self- Report Evaluation, Atrial Fibrillation Effect on Quality of Life Questionnaire

interventions.name: Transthoracic echocardiogram
interventions.description: Transthoracic echocardiogram at rest and immediately following peak exercise during CPET

interventions.name: Cardiovascular magnetic resonance (CMR)
interventions.description: Cardiovascular magnetic resonance (CMR) study at rest and during two stages of submaximal exercise (ExeCMR)

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in LA reservoir function reserve at submaximal exercise after catheter ablation in patients with paroxysmal AF.
primaryOutcomes.description: Change in LA reservoir volume reserve from baseline to follow up, change in left ventricular (LV) stroke volume reserve from baseline to follow up, correlation between changes in LA reservoir volume reserve and changes in LV stroke volume reserve. Therefore the follow up testing will be performed 5-6 months (to be more specific: 150-180 days) after catheter ablation.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline and the follow up testing will be performed 5-6 months (to be more specific: 150-180 days) after catheter ablation.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in LV stroke volume reserve at submaximal exercise after catheter ablation in patients with paroxysmal AF.
secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in LA reservoir volume reserve from baseline to follow up, change in LV stroke volume reserve from baseline to follow up, correlation between changes in LA reservoir volume reserve and changes in LV stroke volume reserve.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline and the follow up testing will be performed 5-6 months (to be more specific: 150-180 days) after catheter ablation.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Correlation between changes in LA reservoir volume reserve and changes in LV stroke vol reserve after catheter ablation in patients with paroxysmal AF
secondaryOutcomes.description: Correlation between changes in LA reservoir volume reserve and changes in LV stroke volume reserve after catheter ablation in patients with paroxysmal AF
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline and the follow up testing will be performed 5-6 months (to be more specific: 150-180 days) after catheter ablation.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Correlation between changes in LA reservoir function reserve at submaximal exercise and changes in mixed venous oxygen tension (pVO2) .
secondaryOutcomes.description: Correlation between changes in LA reservoir function reserve at submaximal exercise and changes in pVO2 after catheter ablation
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline and the follow up testing will be performed 5-6 months (to be more specific: 150-180 days) after catheter ablation.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Correlation between changes in LV stroke volume reserve at submaximal exercise and changes in pVO2
secondaryOutcomes.description: Correlation between changes in LV stroke volume reserve at submaximal exercise and changes in pVO2 after catheter ablation.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline and the follow up testing will be performed 5-6 months (to be more specific: 150-180 days) after catheter ablation.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Correlation between baseline AF burden and LA function, LV Function and pVO2
secondaryOutcomes.description: Correlation between baseline AF burden and LA function (rest and exercise), LV function (rest and exercise), and pVO2
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline and the follow up testing will be performed 5-6 months (to be more specific: 150-180 days) after catheter ablation.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Correlation between the amount of AF burden reduction and the changes in LA function, LV function (rest and exercise), and pVO2.
secondaryOutcomes.description: Correlation between the amount of AF burden reduction and the changes in LA function (rest and exercise), LV function (rest and exercise), and pVO2.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline and the follow up testing will be performed 5-6 months (to be more specific: 150-180 days) after catheter ablation.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Age ≥18 years
* Diagnosis of paroxysmal AF
* Left ventricular ejection fraction ≥50%
* Scheduled for catheter ablation
* Able to speak, hear, and read English
* Willing and able to provide informed consent

Exclusion Criteria:

* Persistent or permanent AF
* Prior ablation (catheter based or surgical) for AF
* Significant sinus node dysfunction
* Implanted pacemaker or defibrillator
* Contraindication to or inability to complete cardiovascular magnetic resonance study
* Contraindication to or inability to complete exercise testing
* Chronic kidney disease with estimated glomerular filtration rate \<30 mL/min/1.73m2
* Severe left ventricular hypertrophy
* Unrelated cardiomyopathy that is expected to limit exercise capacity, including but not limited to:

  * Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy
  * Cardiac amyloidosis
  * Constrictive pericarditis
* Pulmonary arterial hypertension
* Prior cardiac surgery
* Active pregnancy
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: In patients undergoing catheter ablation for paroxysmal AF, reduction or elimination of arrhythmia burden will result in favorable LA reverse remodeling - which will result in improved LA reservoir function reserve during exercise, thereby augmenting LV stroke volume reserve during exercise.
